392#ifndef CL_HPP_
393#define CL_HPP_
394
395/* Handle deprecated preprocessor definitions. In each case, we only check for
396 * the old name if the new name is not defined, so that user code can define
397 * both and hence work with either version of the bindings.
398 */
399#if !defined(CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP) && defined(USE_DX_INTEROP)
400# pragma message("opencl.hpp: USE_DX_INTEROP is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP instead")
401# define CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP
402#endif
403#if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS) && defined(__CL_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
404# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __CL_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS instead")
405# define CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
406#endif
407#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR) && defined(__NO_STD_VECTOR)
408# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __NO_STD_VECTOR is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR instead")
409# define CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR
410#endif
411#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING) && defined(__NO_STD_STRING)
412# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __NO_STD_STRING is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING instead")
413# define CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING
414#endif
415#if defined(VECTOR_CLASS)
416# pragma message("opencl.hpp: VECTOR_CLASS is deprecated. Alias cl::vector instead")
417#endif
418#if defined(STRING_CLASS)
419# pragma message("opencl.hpp: STRING_CLASS is deprecated. Alias cl::string instead.")
420#endif
421#if !defined(CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS) && defined(__CL_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS)
422# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __CL_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS instead")
423# define CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS
424#endif
425
426/* Warn about features that are no longer supported
427 */
428#if defined(__USE_DEV_VECTOR)
429# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __USE_DEV_VECTOR is no longer supported. Expect compilation errors")
430#endif
431#if defined(__USE_DEV_STRING)
432# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __USE_DEV_STRING is no longer supported. Expect compilation errors")
433#endif
434
435/* Detect which version to target */
436#if !defined(CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION)
437# pragma message("opencl.hpp: CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is not defined. It will default to 300 (OpenCL 3.0)")
438# define CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION 300
439#endif
440#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 100 && \
441 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 110 && \
442 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 120 && \
443 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 200 && \
444 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 210 && \
445 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 220 && \
446 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 300
447# pragma message("opencl.hpp: CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is not a valid value (100, 110, 120, 200, 210, 220 or 300). It will be set to 300 (OpenCL 3.0).")
448# undef CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
449# define CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION 300
450#endif
451
452/* Forward target OpenCL version to C headers if necessary */
453#if defined(CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION)
454/* Warn if prior definition of CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is lower than
455 * requested C++ bindings version */
456#if CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
457# pragma message("CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is already defined as is lower than CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION")
458#endif
459#else
460# define CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
461#endif
462
463#if !defined(CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION)
464# define CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION 200
465#endif
466#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 100 && \
467 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 110 && \
468 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 120 && \
469 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 200 && \
470 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 210 && \
471 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 220 && \
472 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 300
473# pragma message("opencl.hpp: CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION is not a valid value (100, 110, 120, 200, 210, 220 or 300). It will be set to 100")
474# undef CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION
475# define CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION 100
476#endif
477#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION > CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
478# error "CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION must not be greater than CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION"
479#endif
480
481#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 100 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_0_APIS)
482# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_0_APIS
483#endif
484#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 110 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
485# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS
486#endif
487#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 120 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_2_APIS)
488# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_2_APIS
489#endif
490#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 200 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_0_APIS)
491# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_0_APIS
492#endif
493#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 210 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_1_APIS)
494# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_1_APIS
495#endif
496#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 220 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_2_APIS)
497# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_2_APIS
498#endif
499
500#ifdef _WIN32
501
502#include <malloc.h>
503
504#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP)
505#include <CL/cl_d3d10.h>
506#include <CL/cl_dx9_media_sharing.h>
507#endif
508#endif // _WIN32
509
510#if defined(_MSC_VER)
511#include <intrin.h>
512#endif // _MSC_VER
513
514 // Check for a valid C++ version
515
516// Need to do both tests here because for some reason __cplusplus is not
517// updated in visual studio
518#if (!defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus < 201103L) || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER < 1700)
519#error Visual studio 2013 or another C++11-supporting compiler required
520#endif
521
522#if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__MACOSX)
523#include <OpenCL/opencl.h>
524#else
525#include <CL/opencl.h>
526#endif // !__APPLE__
527
528#if __cplusplus >= 201703L
529# define CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ inline
530#elif defined(_MSC_VER)
531# define CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ __declspec(selectany)
532#elif defined(__MINGW32__)
533# define CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ __attribute__((selectany))
534#else
535# define CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ __attribute__((weak))
536#endif // !_MSC_VER
537
538// Define deprecated prefixes and suffixes to ensure compilation
539// in case they are not pre-defined
540#if !defined(CL_API_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
541#define CL_API_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
542#endif // #if !defined(CL_API_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
543#if !defined(CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
544#define CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
545#endif // #if !defined(CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
546
547#if !defined(CL_API_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
548#define CL_API_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED
549#endif // #if !defined(CL_API_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
550#if !defined(CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
551#define CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED
552#endif // #if !defined(CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
553
554#if !defined(CL_API_PREFIX__VERSION_2_2_DEPRECATED)
555#define CL_API_PREFIX__VERSION_2_2_DEPRECATED
556#endif // #if !defined(CL_API_PREFIX__VERSION_2_2_DEPRECATED)
557#if !defined(CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_2_2_DEPRECATED)
558#define CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_2_2_DEPRECATED
559#endif // #if !defined(CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_2_2_DEPRECATED)
560
561#if !defined(CL_CALLBACK)
562#define CL_CALLBACK
563#endif //CL_CALLBACK

569#include <cstring>

572
573// Define a size_type to represent a correctly resolved size_t
574#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
575namespace cl {
576 using size_type = ::size_t;
577} // namespace cl
578#else // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
579namespace cl {
580 using size_type = size_t;
581} // namespace cl
582#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
583
584
585#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
586#include <exception>
587#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
588
589#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR)
590#include <vector>
591namespace cl {
592 template < class T, class Alloc = std::allocator<T> >
593 using vector = std::vector<T, Alloc>;
594} // namespace cl
595#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR)
596
597#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING)
598#include <string>
599namespace cl {
600 using string = std::string;
601} // namespace cl
602#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING)
603
604#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
605
606#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_UNIQUE_PTR)
607#include <memory>
608namespace cl {
609 // Replace unique_ptr and allocate_pointer for internal use
610 // to allow user to replace them
611 template<class T, class D>
612 using pointer = std::unique_ptr<T, D>;
613} // namespace cl
614#endif
615#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
616#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_ARRAY)
617#include <array>
618namespace cl {
619 template < class T, size_type N >
620 using array = std::array<T, N>;
621} // namespace cl
622#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_ARRAY)
623
624// Define size_type appropriately to allow backward-compatibility
625// use of the old size_t interface class
626#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
627namespace cl {
628 namespace compatibility {
633 template <int N>
634 class size_t
635 {
636 private:
637 size_type data_[N];
638
639 public:
641 size_t()
642 {
643 for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
644 data_[i] = 0;
645 }
646 }
647
648 size_t(const array<size_type, N> &rhs)
649 {
650 for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
651 data_[i] = rhs[i];
652 }
653 }
654
655 size_type& operator[](int index)
656 {
657 return data_[index];
658 }
659
660 const size_type& operator[](int index) const
661 {
662 return data_[index];
663 }
664
666 operator size_type* () { return data_; }
667
669 operator const size_type* () const { return data_; }
670
671 operator array<size_type, N>() const
672 {
673 array<size_type, N> ret;
674
675 for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
676 ret[i] = data_[i];
677 }
678 return ret;
679 }
680 };
681 } // namespace compatibility
682
683 template<int N>
684 using size_t = compatibility::size_t<N>;
685} // namespace cl
686#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
687
688// Helper alias to avoid confusing the macros
689namespace cl {
690 namespace detail {
691 using size_t_array = array<size_type, 3>;
692 } // namespace detail
693} // namespace cl
694
695
701namespace cl {
702
703#define CL_HPP_CREATE_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_ALIAS_(name) \
704 using PFN_##name = name##_fn
705
706#define CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(name) \
707 if (!pfn_##name) { \
708 pfn_##name = (PFN_##name)clGetExtensionFunctionAddress(#name); \
709 }
710
711#define CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(platform, name) \
712 if (!pfn_##name) { \
713 pfn_##name = (PFN_##name) \
714 clGetExtensionFunctionAddressForPlatform(platform, #name); \
715 }
716
717#ifdef cl_khr_external_memory
718 enum class ExternalMemoryType : cl_external_memory_handle_type_khr;
719#endif
720
721 class Memory;
722 class Platform;
723 class Program;
724 class Device;
725 class Context;
726 class CommandQueue;
727 class DeviceCommandQueue;
728 class Memory;
729 class Buffer;
730 class Pipe;
731#ifdef cl_khr_semaphore
732 class Semaphore;
733#endif
734#if defined(cl_khr_command_buffer)
735 class CommandBufferKhr;
736 class MutableCommandKhr;
737#endif // cl_khr_command_buffer
738
739#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
744 class Error : public std::exception
745 {
746 private:
747 cl_int err_;
748 const char * errStr_;
749 public:
759 Error(cl_int err, const char * errStr = nullptr) : err_(err), errStr_(errStr)
760 {}
761
766 const char * what() const noexcept override
767 {
768 if (errStr_ == nullptr) {
769 return "empty";
770 }
771 else {
772 return errStr_;
773 }
774 }
775
780 cl_int err(void) const { return err_; }
781 };
782#define CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(x) #x
783#else
784#define CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(x) nullptr
785#endif // CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
786
787
788namespace detail
789{
790#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
791static inline cl_int errHandler (
792 cl_int err,
793 const char * errStr = nullptr)
794{
795 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
796 throw Error(err, errStr);
797 }
798 return err;
799}
800#else
801static inline cl_int errHandler (cl_int err, const char * errStr = nullptr)
802{
803 (void) errStr; // suppress unused variable warning
804 return err;
805}
806#endif // CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
807}
808
809

812#if !defined(CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS)
813#define __GET_DEVICE_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetDeviceInfo)
814#define __GET_PLATFORM_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetPlatformInfo)
815#define __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetDeviceIDs)
816#define __GET_PLATFORM_IDS_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetPlatformIDs)
817#define __GET_CONTEXT_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetContextInfo)
818#define __GET_EVENT_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetEventInfo)

820#define __GET_MEM_OBJECT_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetMemObjectInfo)
821#define __GET_IMAGE_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetImageInfo)
822#define __GET_SAMPLER_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetSamplerInfo)
823#define __GET_KERNEL_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetKernelInfo)
824#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
825#define __GET_KERNEL_ARG_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetKernelArgInfo)
826#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
827#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
828#define __GET_KERNEL_SUB_GROUP_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetKernelSubGroupInfo)
829#else
830#define __GET_KERNEL_SUB_GROUP_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetKernelSubGroupInfoKHR)
831#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
832#define __GET_KERNEL_WORK_GROUP_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetKernelWorkGroupInfo)
833#define __GET_PROGRAM_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetProgramInfo)
834#define __GET_PROGRAM_BUILD_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetProgramBuildInfo)

840#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 300

842#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 300

844#define __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCreateBuffer)

846#define __CREATE_SUBBUFFER_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCreateSubBuffer)
847#define __CREATE_GL_BUFFER_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCreateFromGLBuffer)
848#define __CREATE_GL_RENDER_BUFFER_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCreateFromGLBuffer)
849#define __GET_GL_OBJECT_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetGLObjectInfo)

854#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
855#define __SET_MEM_OBJECT_DESTRUCTOR_CALLBACK_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clSetMemObjectDestructorCallback)

858#define __SET_USER_EVENT_STATUS_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clSetUserEventStatus)

934#ifdef cl_khr_external_memory
935#define __ENQUEUE_ACQUIRE_EXTERNAL_MEMORY_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clEnqueueAcquireExternalMemObjectsKHR)

937#endif

1089
1090namespace detail {
1091
1092// Generic getInfoHelper. The final parameter is used to guide overload
1093// resolution: the actual parameter passed is an int, which makes this
1094// a worse conversion sequence than a specialization that declares the
1095// parameter as an int.
1096template<typename Functor, typename T>
1097inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Functor f, cl_uint name, T* param, long)
1098{
1099 return f(name, sizeof(T), param, nullptr);
1100}
1101
1102// Specialized for getInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES>
1103// Assumes that the output vector was correctly resized on the way in
1104template <typename Func>
1105inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, vector<vector<unsigned char>>* param, int)
1106{
1107 if (name != CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES) {
1108 return CL_INVALID_VALUE;
1109 }
1110 if (param) {
1111 // Create array of pointers, calculate total size and pass pointer array in
1112 size_type numBinaries = param->size();
1113 vector<unsigned char*> binariesPointers(numBinaries);
1114
1115 for (size_type i = 0; i < numBinaries; ++i)
1116 {
1117 binariesPointers[i] = (*param)[i].data();
1118 }
1119
1120 cl_int err = f(name, numBinaries * sizeof(unsigned char*), binariesPointers.data(), nullptr);
1121
1122 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1123 return err;
1124 }
1125 }
1126
1127
1128 return CL_SUCCESS;
1129}
1130
1131// Specialized getInfoHelper for vector params
1132template <typename Func, typename T>
1133inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, vector<T>* param, long)
1134{
1135 size_type required;
1136 cl_int err = f(name, 0, nullptr, &required);
1137 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1138 return err;
1139 }
1140 const size_type elements = required / sizeof(T);
1141
1142 // Temporary to avoid changing param on an error
1143 vector<T> localData(elements);
1144 err = f(name, required, localData.data(), nullptr);
1145 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1146 return err;
1147 }
1148 if (param) {
1149 *param = std::move(localData);
1150 }
1151
1152 return CL_SUCCESS;
1153}
1154
1155/* Specialization for reference-counted types. This depends on the
1156 * existence of Wrapper<T>::cl_type, and none of the other types having the
1157 * cl_type member. Note that simplify specifying the parameter as Wrapper<T>
1158 * does not work, because when using a derived type (e.g. Context) the generic
1159 * template will provide a better match.
1160 */
1161template <typename Func, typename T>
1162inline cl_int getInfoHelper(
1163 Func f, cl_uint name, vector<T>* param, int, typename T::cl_type = 0)
1164{
1165 size_type required;
1166 cl_int err = f(name, 0, nullptr, &required);
1167 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1168 return err;
1169 }
1170
1171 const size_type elements = required / sizeof(typename T::cl_type);
1172
1173 vector<typename T::cl_type> value(elements);
1174 err = f(name, required, value.data(), nullptr);
1175 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1176 return err;
1177 }
1178
1179 if (param) {
1180 // Assign to convert CL type to T for each element
1181 param->resize(elements);
1182
1183 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
1184 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
1185 for (size_type i = 0; i < elements; i++) {
1186 (*param)[i] = T(value[i], true);
1187 }
1188 }
1189 return CL_SUCCESS;
1190}
1191
1192// Specialized GetInfoHelper for string params
1193template <typename Func>
1194inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, string* param, long)
1195{
1196 size_type required;
1197 cl_int err = f(name, 0, nullptr, &required);
1198 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1199 return err;
1200 }
1201
1202 // std::string has a constant data member
1203 // a char vector does not
1204 if (required > 0) {
1205 vector<char> value(required);
1206 err = f(name, required, value.data(), nullptr);
1207 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1208 return err;
1209 }
1210 if (param) {
1211 param->assign(value.begin(), value.end() - 1);
1212 }
1213 }
1214 else if (param) {
1215 param->assign("");
1216 }
1217 return CL_SUCCESS;
1218}
1219
1220// Specialized GetInfoHelper for clsize_t params
1221template <typename Func, size_type N>
1222inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, array<size_type, N>* param, long)
1223{
1224 size_type required;
1225 cl_int err = f(name, 0, nullptr, &required);
1226 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1227 return err;
1228 }
1229
1230 size_type elements = required / sizeof(size_type);
1231 vector<size_type> value(elements, 0);
1232
1233 err = f(name, required, value.data(), nullptr);
1234 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1235 return err;
1236 }
1237
1238 // Bound the copy with N to prevent overruns
1239 // if passed N > than the amount copied
1240 if (elements > N) {
1241 elements = N;
1242 }
1243 for (size_type i = 0; i < elements; ++i) {
1244 (*param)[i] = value[i];
1245 }
1246
1247 return CL_SUCCESS;
1248}
1249
1250template<typename T> struct ReferenceHandler;
1251
1252/* Specialization for reference-counted types. This depends on the
1253 * existence of Wrapper<T>::cl_type, and none of the other types having the
1254 * cl_type member. Note that simplify specifying the parameter as Wrapper<T>
1255 * does not work, because when using a derived type (e.g. Context) the generic
1256 * template will provide a better match.
1257 */
1258template<typename Func, typename T>
1259inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, T* param, int, typename T::cl_type = 0)
1260{
1261 typename T::cl_type value;
1262 cl_int err = f(name, sizeof(value), &value, nullptr);
1263 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1264 return err;
1265 }
1266 *param = value;
1267 if (value != nullptr)
1268 {
1269 err = param->retain();
1270 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1271 return err;
1272 }
1273 }
1274 return CL_SUCCESS;
1275}
1276
1277#define CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_0_(F) \
1278 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_PROFILE, string) \
1279 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_VERSION, string) \
1280 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_NAME, string) \
1281 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_VENDOR, string) \
1282 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_EXTENSIONS, string) \
1283 \
1284 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_TYPE, cl_device_type) \
1285 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_VENDOR_ID, cl_uint) \
1286 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_COMPUTE_UNITS, cl_uint) \
1287 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_DIMENSIONS, cl_uint) \
1288 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE, size_type) \
1289 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES, cl::vector<size_type>) \
1290 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_CHAR, cl_uint) \

1294 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_FLOAT, cl_uint) \

1357 \

1559#define CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_3_0_(F) \
1560 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_NUMERIC_VERSION, cl_version) \
1561 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_EXTENSIONS_WITH_VERSION, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1562 \
1563 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_NUMERIC_VERSION, cl_version) \
1564 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_EXTENSIONS_WITH_VERSION, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1565 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_ILS_WITH_VERSION, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1566 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_BUILT_IN_KERNELS_WITH_VERSION, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1567 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_ATOMIC_MEMORY_CAPABILITIES, cl_device_atomic_capabilities) \
1568 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_ATOMIC_FENCE_CAPABILITIES, cl_device_atomic_capabilities) \
1569 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_NON_UNIFORM_WORK_GROUP_SUPPORT, cl_bool) \
1570 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_OPENCL_C_ALL_VERSIONS, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1571 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_WORK_GROUP_SIZE_MULTIPLE, size_type) \
1572 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_WORK_GROUP_COLLECTIVE_FUNCTIONS_SUPPORT, cl_bool) \
1573 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_GENERIC_ADDRESS_SPACE_SUPPORT, cl_bool) \
1574 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_OPENCL_C_FEATURES, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1575 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_DEVICE_ENQUEUE_CAPABILITIES, cl_device_device_enqueue_capabilities) \
1576 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PIPE_SUPPORT, cl_bool) \
1577 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_LATEST_CONFORMANCE_VERSION_PASSED, string) \
1578 \
1579 F(cl_command_queue_info, CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES_ARRAY, cl::vector<cl_queue_properties>) \
1580 F(cl_mem_info, CL_MEM_PROPERTIES, cl::vector<cl_mem_properties>) \
1581 F(cl_pipe_info, CL_PIPE_PROPERTIES, cl::vector<cl_pipe_properties>) \
1582 F(cl_sampler_info, CL_SAMPLER_PROPERTIES, cl::vector<cl_sampler_properties>) \
1583
1584template <typename enum_type, cl_int Name>
1585struct param_traits {};
1586
1587#define CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_(token, param_name, T) \
1588struct token; \
1589template<> \
1590struct param_traits<detail:: token,param_name> \
1591{ \
1592 enum { value = param_name }; \
1593 typedef T param_type; \
1594};
1595
1596CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1597#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
1598CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_1_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1599#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
1600#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1601CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_2_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1602#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1603#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
1604CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_2_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1605#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
1606#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
1607CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_2_1_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1608#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
1609#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 220
1610CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_2_2_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1611#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 220
1612#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 300
1613CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_3_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1614#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 300
1615

1618#endif // #if defined(cl_khr_subgroups) && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < 210

1626#define CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_0_DEPRECATED_IN_2_0_(F) \
1627 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, cl_command_queue_properties)

1633 F(cl_image_info, CL_IMAGE_BUFFER, cl::Buffer)
1634
1635// Include deprecated query flags based on versions
1636// Only include deprecated 1.0 flags if 2.0 not active as there is an enum clash
1637#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION > 100 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200 && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
1638CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_0_DEPRECATED_IN_2_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1639#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 110
1640#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION > 110 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
1641CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_1_DEPRECATED_IN_2_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1642#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1643#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION > 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
1644CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_2_DEPRECATED_IN_2_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1645#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200

1649#endif // cl_ext_device_fission

1671CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_CL_KHR_EXTERNAL_SEMAPHORE_DX_FENCE_EXT(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1672#endif // cl_khr_external_semaphore_dx_fence
1673#if defined(cl_khr_external_semaphore_opaque_fd)
1674CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_CL_KHR_EXTERNAL_SEMAPHORE_OPAQUE_FD_EXT(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1675#endif // cl_khr_external_semaphore_opaque_fd
1676#if defined(cl_khr_external_semaphore_sync_fd)
1677CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_CL_KHR_EXTERNAL_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_FD_EXT(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1678#endif // cl_khr_external_semaphore_sync_fd
1679#if defined(cl_khr_external_semaphore_win32)
1680CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_CL_KHR_EXTERNAL_SEMAPHORE_WIN32_EXT(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1681#endif // cl_khr_external_semaphore_win32

1686CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_UUID_KHR, uuid_array)

1830
1831// Convenience functions
1832
1833template <typename Func, typename T>
1834inline cl_int
1835getInfo(Func f, cl_uint name, T* param)
1836{
1837 return getInfoHelper(f, name, param, 0);
1838}
1839
1840template <typename Func, typename Arg0>
1841struct GetInfoFunctor0
1842{
1843 Func f_; const Arg0& arg0_;
1844 cl_int operator ()(
1845 cl_uint param, size_type size, void* value, size_type* size_ret)
1846 { return f_(arg0_, param, size, value, size_ret); }
1847};
1848
1849template <typename Func, typename Arg0, typename Arg1>
1850struct GetInfoFunctor1
1851{
1852 Func f_; const Arg0& arg0_; const Arg1& arg1_;
1853 cl_int operator ()(
1854 cl_uint param, size_type size, void* value, size_type* size_ret)
1855 { return f_(arg0_, arg1_, param, size, value, size_ret); }
1856};
1857
1858template <typename Func, typename Arg0, typename T>
1859inline cl_int
1860getInfo(Func f, const Arg0& arg0, cl_uint name, T* param)
1861{
1862 GetInfoFunctor0<Func, Arg0> f0 = { f, arg0 };
1863 return getInfoHelper(f0, name, param, 0);
1864}
1865
1866template <typename Func, typename Arg0, typename Arg1, typename T>
1867inline cl_int
1868getInfo(Func f, const Arg0& arg0, const Arg1& arg1, cl_uint name, T* param)
1869{
1870 GetInfoFunctor1<Func, Arg0, Arg1> f0 = { f, arg0, arg1 };
1871 return getInfoHelper(f0, name, param, 0);
1872}
1873
1874
1875template<typename T>
1876struct ReferenceHandler
1877{ };
1878
1879#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1883template <>
1884struct ReferenceHandler<cl_device_id>
1885{
1895 static cl_int retain(cl_device_id device)
1896 { return ::clRetainDevice(device); }
1906 static cl_int release(cl_device_id device)
1907 { return ::clReleaseDevice(device); }
1908};
1909#else // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1913template <>
1914struct ReferenceHandler<cl_device_id>
1915{
1916 // cl_device_id does not have retain().
1917 static cl_int retain(cl_device_id)
1918 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1919 // cl_device_id does not have release().
1920 static cl_int release(cl_device_id)
1921 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1922};
1923#endif // ! (CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120)
1924
1925template <>
1926struct ReferenceHandler<cl_platform_id>
1927{
1928 // cl_platform_id does not have retain().
1929 static cl_int retain(cl_platform_id)
1930 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1931 // cl_platform_id does not have release().
1932 static cl_int release(cl_platform_id)
1933 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1934};
1935
1936template <>
1937struct ReferenceHandler<cl_context>
1938{
1939 static cl_int retain(cl_context context)
1940 { return ::clRetainContext(context); }
1941 static cl_int release(cl_context context)
1942 { return ::clReleaseContext(context); }
1943};
1944
1945template <>
1946struct ReferenceHandler<cl_command_queue>
1947{
1948 static cl_int retain(cl_command_queue queue)
1949 { return ::clRetainCommandQueue(queue); }
1950 static cl_int release(cl_command_queue queue)
1951 { return ::clReleaseCommandQueue(queue); }
1952};
1953
1954template <>
1955struct ReferenceHandler<cl_mem>
1956{
1957 static cl_int retain(cl_mem memory)
1958 { return ::clRetainMemObject(memory); }
1959 static cl_int release(cl_mem memory)
1960 { return ::clReleaseMemObject(memory); }
1961};
1962
1963template <>
1964struct ReferenceHandler<cl_sampler>
1965{
1966 static cl_int retain(cl_sampler sampler)
1967 { return ::clRetainSampler(sampler); }
1968 static cl_int release(cl_sampler sampler)
1969 { return ::clReleaseSampler(sampler); }
1970};
1971
1972template <>
1973struct ReferenceHandler<cl_program>
1974{
1975 static cl_int retain(cl_program program)
1976 { return ::clRetainProgram(program); }
1977 static cl_int release(cl_program program)
1978 { return ::clReleaseProgram(program); }
1979};
1980
1981template <>
1982struct ReferenceHandler<cl_kernel>
1983{
1984 static cl_int retain(cl_kernel kernel)
1985 { return ::clRetainKernel(kernel); }
1986 static cl_int release(cl_kernel kernel)
1987 { return ::clReleaseKernel(kernel); }
1988};
1989
1990template <>
1991struct ReferenceHandler<cl_event>
1992{
1993 static cl_int retain(cl_event event)
1994 { return ::clRetainEvent(event); }
1995 static cl_int release(cl_event event)
1996 { return ::clReleaseEvent(event); }
1997};
1998
1999#ifdef cl_khr_semaphore
2000template <>
2001struct ReferenceHandler<cl_semaphore_khr>
2002{
2003 static cl_int retain(cl_semaphore_khr semaphore)
2004 {
2005 if (pfn_clRetainSemaphoreKHR != nullptr) {
2006 return pfn_clRetainSemaphoreKHR(semaphore);
2007 }
2008
2009 return CL_INVALID_OPERATION;
2010 }
2011
2012 static cl_int release(cl_semaphore_khr semaphore)
2013 {
2014 if (pfn_clReleaseSemaphoreKHR != nullptr) {
2015 return pfn_clReleaseSemaphoreKHR(semaphore);
2016 }
2017
2018 return CL_INVALID_OPERATION;
2019 }
2020};
2021#endif // cl_khr_semaphore
2022#if defined(cl_khr_command_buffer)
2023template <>
2024struct ReferenceHandler<cl_command_buffer_khr>
2025{
2026 static cl_int retain(cl_command_buffer_khr cmdBufferKhr)
2027 {
2028 if (pfn_clRetainCommandBufferKHR == nullptr) {
2029 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_OPERATION, __RETAIN_COMMAND_BUFFER_KHR_ERR);
2030 }
2031 return pfn_clRetainCommandBufferKHR(cmdBufferKhr);
2032 }
2033
2034 static cl_int release(cl_command_buffer_khr cmdBufferKhr)
2035 {
2036 if (pfn_clReleaseCommandBufferKHR == nullptr) {
2037 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_OPERATION, __RELEASE_COMMAND_BUFFER_KHR_ERR);
2038 }
2039 return pfn_clReleaseCommandBufferKHR(cmdBufferKhr);
2040 }
2041};
2042
2043template <>
2044struct ReferenceHandler<cl_mutable_command_khr>
2045{
2046 // cl_mutable_command_khr does not have retain().
2047 static cl_int retain(cl_mutable_command_khr)
2048 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
2049 // cl_mutable_command_khr does not have release().
2050 static cl_int release(cl_mutable_command_khr)
2051 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
2052};
2053#endif // cl_khr_command_buffer
2054
2055
2056#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
2057// Extracts version number with major in the upper 16 bits, minor in the lower 16
2058static cl_uint getVersion(const vector<char> &versionInfo)
2059{
2060 int highVersion = 0;
2061 int lowVersion = 0;
2062 int index = 7;
2063 while(versionInfo[index] != '.' ) {
2064 highVersion *= 10;
2065 highVersion += versionInfo[index]-'0';
2066 ++index;
2067 }
2068 ++index;
2069 while(versionInfo[index] != ' ' && versionInfo[index] != '\0') {
2070 lowVersion *= 10;
2071 lowVersion += versionInfo[index]-'0';
2072 ++index;
2073 }
2074 return (highVersion << 16) | lowVersion;
2075}
2076
2077static cl_uint getPlatformVersion(cl_platform_id platform)
2078{
2079 size_type size = 0;
2080 clGetPlatformInfo(platform, CL_PLATFORM_VERSION, 0, nullptr, &size);
2081
2082 vector<char> versionInfo(size);
2083 clGetPlatformInfo(platform, CL_PLATFORM_VERSION, size, versionInfo.data(), &size);
2084 return getVersion(versionInfo);
2085}
2086
2087static cl_uint getDevicePlatformVersion(cl_device_id device)
2088{
2089 cl_platform_id platform;
2090 clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_PLATFORM, sizeof(platform), &platform, nullptr);
2091 return getPlatformVersion(platform);
2092}
2093
2094static cl_uint getContextPlatformVersion(cl_context context)
2095{
2096 // The platform cannot be queried directly, so we first have to grab a
2097 // device and obtain its context
2098 size_type size = 0;
2099 clGetContextInfo(context, CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, 0, nullptr, &size);
2100 if (size == 0)
2101 return 0;
2102 vector<cl_device_id> devices(size/sizeof(cl_device_id));
2103 clGetContextInfo(context, CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, size, devices.data(), nullptr);
2104 return getDevicePlatformVersion(devices[0]);
2105}
2106#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
2107
2108template <typename T>
2109class Wrapper
2110{
2111public:
2112 typedef T cl_type;
2113
2114protected:
2115 cl_type object_;
2116
2117public:
2118 Wrapper() : object_(nullptr) { }
2119
2120 Wrapper(const cl_type &obj, bool retainObject) : object_(obj)
2121 {
2122 if (retainObject) {
2123 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
2124 }
2125 }
2126
2127 ~Wrapper()
2128 {
2129 if (object_ != nullptr) { release(); }
2130 }
2131
2132 Wrapper(const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
2133 {
2134 object_ = rhs.object_;
2135 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
2136 }
2137
2138 Wrapper(Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs) noexcept
2139 {
2140 object_ = rhs.object_;
2141 rhs.object_ = nullptr;
2142 }
2143
2144 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
2145 {
2146 if (this != &rhs) {
2147 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
2148 object_ = rhs.object_;
2149 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
2150 }
2151 return *this;
2152 }
2153
2154 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs)
2155 {
2156 if (this != &rhs) {
2157 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
2158 object_ = rhs.object_;
2159 rhs.object_ = nullptr;
2160 }
2161 return *this;
2162 }
2163
2164 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const cl_type &rhs)
2165 {
2166 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
2167 object_ = rhs;
2168 return *this;
2169 }
2170
2171 const cl_type& operator ()() const { return object_; }
2172
2173 cl_type& operator ()() { return object_; }
2174
2175 cl_type get() const { return object_; }
2176
2177protected:
2178 template<typename Func, typename U>
2179 friend inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func, cl_uint, U*, int, typename U::cl_type);
2180
2181 cl_int retain() const
2182 {
2183 if (object_ != nullptr) {
2184 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::retain(object_);
2185 }
2186 else {
2187 return CL_SUCCESS;
2188 }
2189 }
2190
2191 cl_int release() const
2192 {
2193 if (object_ != nullptr) {
2194 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::release(object_);
2195 }
2196 else {
2197 return CL_SUCCESS;
2198 }
2199 }
2200};
2201
2202template <>
2203class Wrapper<cl_device_id>
2204{
2205public:
2206 typedef cl_device_id cl_type;
2207
2208protected:
2209 cl_type object_;
2210 bool referenceCountable_;
2211
2212 static bool isReferenceCountable(cl_device_id device)
2213 {
2214 bool retVal = false;
2215#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2216#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
2217 if (device != nullptr) {
2218 int version = getDevicePlatformVersion(device);
2219 if(version > ((1 << 16) + 1)) {
2220 retVal = true;
2221 }
2222 }
2223#else // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
2224 retVal = true;
2225#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
2226#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2227 (void)device;
2228 return retVal;
2229 }
2230
2231public:
2232 Wrapper() : object_(nullptr), referenceCountable_(false)
2233 {
2234 }
2235
2236 Wrapper(const cl_type &obj, bool retainObject) :
2237 object_(obj),
2238 referenceCountable_(false)
2239 {
2240 referenceCountable_ = isReferenceCountable(obj);
2241
2242 if (retainObject) {
2243 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
2244 }
2245 }
2246
2247 ~Wrapper()
2248 {
2249 release();
2250 }
2251
2252 Wrapper(const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
2253 {
2254 object_ = rhs.object_;
2255 referenceCountable_ = isReferenceCountable(object_);
2256 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
2257 }
2258
2259 Wrapper(Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs) noexcept
2260 {
2261 object_ = rhs.object_;
2262 referenceCountable_ = rhs.referenceCountable_;
2263 rhs.object_ = nullptr;
2264 rhs.referenceCountable_ = false;
2265 }
2266
2267 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
2268 {
2269 if (this != &rhs) {
2270 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
2271 object_ = rhs.object_;
2272 referenceCountable_ = rhs.referenceCountable_;
2273 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
2274 }
2275 return *this;
2276 }
2277
2278 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs)
2279 {
2280 if (this != &rhs) {
2281 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
2282 object_ = rhs.object_;
2283 referenceCountable_ = rhs.referenceCountable_;
2284 rhs.object_ = nullptr;
2285 rhs.referenceCountable_ = false;
2286 }
2287 return *this;
2288 }
2289
2290 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const cl_type &rhs)
2291 {
2292 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
2293 object_ = rhs;
2294 referenceCountable_ = isReferenceCountable(object_);
2295 return *this;
2296 }
2297
2298 const cl_type& operator ()() const { return object_; }
2299
2300 cl_type& operator ()() { return object_; }
2301
2302 cl_type get() const { return object_; }
2303
2304protected:
2305 template<typename Func, typename U>
2306 friend inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func, cl_uint, U*, int, typename U::cl_type);
2307
2308 template<typename Func, typename U>
2309 friend inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func, cl_uint, vector<U>*, int, typename U::cl_type);
2310
2311 cl_int retain() const
2312 {
2313 if( object_ != nullptr && referenceCountable_ ) {
2314 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::retain(object_);
2315 }
2316 else {
2317 return CL_SUCCESS;
2318 }
2319 }
2320
2321 cl_int release() const
2322 {
2323 if (object_ != nullptr && referenceCountable_) {
2324 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::release(object_);
2325 }
2326 else {
2327 return CL_SUCCESS;
2328 }
2329 }
2330};
2331
2332template <typename T>
2333inline bool operator==(const Wrapper<T> &lhs, const Wrapper<T> &rhs)
2334{
2335 return lhs() == rhs();
2336}
2337
2338template <typename T>
2339inline bool operator!=(const Wrapper<T> &lhs, const Wrapper<T> &rhs)
2340{
2341 return !operator==(lhs, rhs);
2342}
2343
2344} // namespace detail
2346
2347
2348
2349
2350
2356struct ImageFormat : public cl_image_format
2357{
2359 ImageFormat(){}
2360
2362 ImageFormat(cl_channel_order order, cl_channel_type type)
2363 {
2364 image_channel_order = order;
2365 image_channel_data_type = type;
2366 }
2367
2369 ImageFormat(const ImageFormat &other) { *this = other; }
2370
2372 ImageFormat& operator = (const ImageFormat& rhs)
2373 {
2374 if (this != &rhs) {
2375 this->image_channel_data_type = rhs.image_channel_data_type;
2376 this->image_channel_order = rhs.image_channel_order;
2377 }
2378 return *this;
2379 }
2380};
2381
2389class Device : public detail::Wrapper<cl_device_id>
2390{
2391private:
2392 static std::once_flag default_initialized_;
2393 static Device default_;
2394 static cl_int default_error_;
2395
2401 static void makeDefault();
2402
2408 static void makeDefaultProvided(const Device &p) {
2409 default_ = p;
2410 }
2411
2412public:
2413#ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2420 static void unitTestClearDefault() {
2421 default_ = Device();
2422 }
2423#endif // #ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2424
2426 Device() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
2427
2432 explicit Device(const cl_device_id &device, bool retainObject = false) :
2433 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(device, retainObject) { }
2434
2439 static Device getDefault(
2440 cl_int *errResult = nullptr)
2441 {
2442 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefault);
2443 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2444 if (errResult != nullptr) {
2445 *errResult = default_error_;
2446 }
2447 return default_;
2448 }
2449
2457 static Device setDefault(const Device &default_device)
2458 {
2459 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefaultProvided, std::cref(default_device));
2460 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2461 return default_;
2462 }
2463
2468 Device& operator = (const cl_device_id& rhs)
2469 {
2470 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
2471 return *this;
2472 }
2473
2474
2476 template <typename T>
2477 cl_int getInfo(cl_device_info name, T* param) const
2478 {
2479 return detail::errHandler(
2480 detail::getInfo(&::clGetDeviceInfo, object_, name, param),
2481 __GET_DEVICE_INFO_ERR);
2482 }
2483
2485 template <cl_device_info name> typename
2486 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_device_info, name>::param_type
2487 getInfo(cl_int* err = nullptr) const
2488 {
2489 typename detail::param_traits<
2490 detail::cl_device_info, name>::param_type param;
2491 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
2492 if (err != nullptr) {
2493 *err = result;
2494 }
2495 return param;
2496 }
2497
2498#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
2505 cl_ulong getHostTimer(cl_int *error = nullptr)
2506 {
2507 cl_ulong retVal = 0;
2508 cl_int err =
2509 clGetHostTimer(this->get(), &retVal);
2510 detail::errHandler(
2511 err,
2512 __GET_HOST_TIMER_ERR);
2513 if (error) {
2514 *error = err;
2515 }
2516 return retVal;
2517 }
2518
2529 std::pair<cl_ulong, cl_ulong> getDeviceAndHostTimer(cl_int *error = nullptr)
2530 {
2531 std::pair<cl_ulong, cl_ulong> retVal;
2532 cl_int err =
2533 clGetDeviceAndHostTimer(this->get(), &(retVal.first), &(retVal.second));
2534 detail::errHandler(
2535 err,
2536 __GET_DEVICE_AND_HOST_TIMER_ERR);
2537 if (error) {
2538 *error = err;
2539 }
2540 return retVal;
2541 }
2542#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
2543
2544#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2546 cl_int createSubDevices(const cl_device_partition_property* properties,
2547 vector<Device>* devices);
2548#endif // defined (CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120)
2549
2550#if defined(cl_ext_device_fission)
2552 cl_int createSubDevices(const cl_device_partition_property_ext* properties,
2553 vector<Device>* devices);
2554#endif // defined(cl_ext_device_fission)
2555};
2556
2557using BuildLogType = vector<std::pair<cl::Device, typename detail::param_traits<detail::cl_program_build_info, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>::param_type>>;
2558#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2562class BuildError : public Error
2563{
2564private:
2565 BuildLogType buildLogs;
2566public:
2567 BuildError(cl_int err, const char * errStr, const BuildLogType &vec) : Error(err, errStr), buildLogs(vec)
2568 {
2569 }
2570
2571 BuildLogType getBuildLog() const
2572 {
2573 return buildLogs;
2574 }
2575};
2576namespace detail {
2577 static inline cl_int buildErrHandler(
2578 cl_int err,
2579 const char * errStr,
2580 const BuildLogType &buildLogs)
2581 {
2582 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2583 throw BuildError(err, errStr, buildLogs);
2584 }
2585 return err;
2586 }
2587} // namespace detail
2588
2589#else
2590namespace detail {
2591 static inline cl_int buildErrHandler(
2592 cl_int err,
2593 const char * errStr,
2594 const BuildLogType &buildLogs)
2595 {
2596 (void)buildLogs; // suppress unused variable warning
2597 (void)errStr;
2598 return err;
2599 }
2600} // namespace detail
2601#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2602
2603CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ std::once_flag Device::default_initialized_;
2604CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ Device Device::default_;
2605CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ cl_int Device::default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
2606
2614class Platform : public detail::Wrapper<cl_platform_id>
2615{
2616private:
2617 static std::once_flag default_initialized_;
2618 static Platform default_;
2619 static cl_int default_error_;
2620
2626 static void makeDefault() {
2627 /* Throwing an exception from a call_once invocation does not do
2628 * what we wish, so we catch it and save the error.
2629 */
2630#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2631 try
2632#endif
2633 {
2634 // If default wasn't passed ,generate one
2635 // Otherwise set it
2636 cl_uint n = 0;
2637
2638 cl_int err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(0, nullptr, &n);
2639 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2640 default_error_ = err;
2641 return;
2642 }
2643 if (n == 0) {
2644 default_error_ = CL_INVALID_PLATFORM;
2645 return;
2646 }
2647
2648 vector<cl_platform_id> ids(n);
2649 err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(n, ids.data(), nullptr);
2650 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2651 default_error_ = err;
2652 return;
2653 }
2654
2655 default_ = Platform(ids[0]);
2656 }
2657#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2658 catch (cl::Error &e) {
2659 default_error_ = e.err();
2660 }
2661#endif
2662 }
2663
2669 static void makeDefaultProvided(const Platform &p) {
2670 default_ = p;
2671 }
2672
2673public:
2674#ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2681 static void unitTestClearDefault() {
2682 default_ = Platform();
2683 }
2684#endif // #ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2685
2687 Platform() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
2688
2696 explicit Platform(const cl_platform_id &platform, bool retainObject = false) :
2697 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(platform, retainObject) { }
2698
2703 Platform& operator = (const cl_platform_id& rhs)
2704 {
2705 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
2706 return *this;
2707 }
2708
2709 static Platform getDefault(
2710 cl_int *errResult = nullptr)
2711 {
2712 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefault);
2713 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2714 if (errResult != nullptr) {
2715 *errResult = default_error_;
2716 }
2717 return default_;
2718 }
2719
2727 static Platform setDefault(const Platform &default_platform)
2728 {
2729 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefaultProvided, std::cref(default_platform));
2730 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2731 return default_;
2732 }
2733
2735 template <typename T>
2736 cl_int getInfo(cl_platform_info name, T* param) const
2737 {
2738 return detail::errHandler(
2739 detail::getInfo(&::clGetPlatformInfo, object_, name, param),
2740 __GET_PLATFORM_INFO_ERR);
2741 }
2742
2744 template <cl_platform_info name> typename
2745 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_platform_info, name>::param_type
2746 getInfo(cl_int* err = nullptr) const
2747 {
2748 typename detail::param_traits<
2749 detail::cl_platform_info, name>::param_type param;
2750 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
2751 if (err != nullptr) {
2752 *err = result;
2753 }
2754 return param;
2755 }
2756
2761 cl_int getDevices(
2762 cl_device_type type,
2763 vector<Device>* devices) const
2764 {
2765 cl_uint n = 0;
2766 if( devices == nullptr ) {
2767 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2768 }
2769 cl_int err = ::clGetDeviceIDs(object_, type, 0, nullptr, &n);
2770 if (err != CL_SUCCESS && err != CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND) {
2771 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2772 }
2773
2774 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2775 if (n>0) {
2776 err = ::clGetDeviceIDs(object_, type, n, ids.data(), nullptr);
2777 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2778 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2779 }
2780 }
2781
2782 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2783 // with safe construction
2784 // We must retain things we obtain from the API to avoid releasing
2785 // API-owned objects.
2786 if (devices) {
2787 devices->resize(ids.size());
2788
2789 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2790 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2791 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2792 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], true);
2793 }
2794 }
2795 return CL_SUCCESS;
2796 }
2797
2798#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP)
2822 cl_int getDevices(
2823 cl_d3d10_device_source_khr d3d_device_source,
2824 void * d3d_object,
2825 cl_d3d10_device_set_khr d3d_device_set,
2826 vector<Device>* devices) const
2827 {
2828 typedef CL_API_ENTRY cl_int (CL_API_CALL *PFN_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR)(
2829 cl_platform_id platform,
2830 cl_d3d10_device_source_khr d3d_device_source,
2831 void * d3d_object,
2832 cl_d3d10_device_set_khr d3d_device_set,
2833 cl_uint num_entries,
2834 cl_device_id * devices,
2835 cl_uint* num_devices);
2836
2837 if( devices == nullptr ) {
2838 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2839 }
2840
2841 static PFN_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR pfn_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR = nullptr;
2842#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2843 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(object_, clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR);
2844#endif
2845#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
2846 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR);
2847#endif
2848
2849 cl_uint n = 0;
2850 cl_int err = pfn_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR(
2851 object_,
2852 d3d_device_source,
2853 d3d_object,
2854 d3d_device_set,
2855 0,
2856 nullptr,
2857 &n);
2858 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2859 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2860 }
2861
2862 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2863 err = pfn_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR(
2864 object_,
2865 d3d_device_source,
2866 d3d_object,
2867 d3d_device_set,
2868 n,
2869 ids.data(),
2870 nullptr);
2871 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2872 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2873 }
2874
2875 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2876 // with safe construction
2877 // We must retain things we obtain from the API to avoid releasing
2878 // API-owned objects.
2879 if (devices) {
2880 devices->resize(ids.size());
2881
2882 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2883 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2884 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2885 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], true);
2886 }
2887 }
2888 return CL_SUCCESS;
2889 }
2890#endif
2891
2896 static cl_int get(
2897 vector<Platform>* platforms)
2898 {
2899 cl_uint n = 0;
2900
2901 if( platforms == nullptr ) {
2902 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE, __GET_PLATFORM_IDS_ERR);
2903 }
2904
2905 cl_int err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(0, nullptr, &n);
2906 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2907 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_PLATFORM_IDS_ERR);
2908 }
2909
2910 vector<cl_platform_id> ids(n);
2911 err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(n, ids.data(), nullptr);
2912 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2913 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_PLATFORM_IDS_ERR);
2914 }
2915
2916 if (platforms) {
2917 platforms->resize(ids.size());
2918
2919 // Platforms don't reference count
2920 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2921 (*platforms)[i] = Platform(ids[i]);
2922 }
2923 }
2924 return CL_SUCCESS;
2925 }
2926
2931 static cl_int get(
2932 Platform * platform)
2933 {
2934 cl_int err;
2935 Platform default_platform = Platform::getDefault(&err);
2936 if (platform) {
2937 *platform = default_platform;
2938 }
2939 return err;
2940 }
2941
2950 static Platform get(
2951 cl_int * errResult = nullptr)
2952 {
2953 cl_int err;
2954 Platform default_platform = Platform::getDefault(&err);
2955 if (errResult) {
2956 *errResult = err;
2957 }
2958 return default_platform;
2959 }
2960
2961#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2963 cl_int
2964 unloadCompiler()
2965 {
2966 return ::clUnloadPlatformCompiler(object_);
2967 }
2968#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2969}; // class Platform
2970
2971#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2973inline cl_int Device::createSubDevices(const cl_device_partition_property* properties,
2974 vector<Device>* devices)
2975{
2976 cl_uint n = 0;
2977 cl_int err = clCreateSubDevices(object_, properties, 0, nullptr, &n);
2978 if (err != CL_SUCCESS)
2979 {
2980 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
2981 }
2982
2983 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2984 err = clCreateSubDevices(object_, properties, n, ids.data(), nullptr);
2985 if (err != CL_SUCCESS)
2986 {
2987 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
2988 }
2989
2990 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2991 // with safe construction
2992 if (devices)
2993 {
2994 devices->resize(ids.size());
2995
2996 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2997 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2998 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++)
2999 {
3000 // We do not need to retain because this device is being created
3001 // by the runtime
3002 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], false);
3003 }
3004 }
3005
3006 return CL_SUCCESS;
3007}
3008#endif // defined (CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120)
3009
3010#if defined(cl_ext_device_fission)
3012inline cl_int Device::createSubDevices(const cl_device_partition_property_ext* properties,
3013 vector<Device>* devices)
3014{
3015 typedef CL_API_ENTRY cl_int(CL_API_CALL * PFN_clCreateSubDevicesEXT)(
3016 cl_device_id /*in_device*/,
3017 const cl_device_partition_property_ext* /* properties */,
3018 cl_uint /*num_entries*/, cl_device_id* /*out_devices*/,
3019 cl_uint* /*num_devices*/) CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1;
3020
3021 static PFN_clCreateSubDevicesEXT pfn_clCreateSubDevicesEXT = nullptr;
3022#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
3023 cl::Device device(object_);
3024 cl_platform_id platform = device.getInfo<CL_DEVICE_PLATFORM>()();
3025 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(platform, clCreateSubDevicesEXT);
3026#endif
3027#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
3028 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clCreateSubDevicesEXT);
3029#endif
3030
3031 cl_uint n = 0;
3032 cl_int err = pfn_clCreateSubDevicesEXT(object_, properties, 0, nullptr, &n);
3033 if (err != CL_SUCCESS)
3034 {
3035 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
3036 }
3037
3038 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
3039 err =
3040 pfn_clCreateSubDevicesEXT(object_, properties, n, ids.data(), nullptr);
3041 if (err != CL_SUCCESS)
3042 {
3043 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
3044 }
3045 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
3046 // with safe construction
3047 if (devices)
3048 {
3049 devices->resize(ids.size());
3050
3051 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
3052 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
3053 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++)
3054 {
3055 // We do not need to retain because this device is being created
3056 // by the runtime
3057 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], false);
3058 }
3059 }
3060
3061 return CL_SUCCESS;
3062}
3063#endif // defined(cl_ext_device_fission)
3064
3065CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ std::once_flag Platform::default_initialized_;
3066CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ Platform Platform::default_;
3067CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ cl_int Platform::default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
3068
3069
3073#if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
3078inline CL_API_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED cl_int
3079UnloadCompiler() CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED;
3080inline cl_int
3081UnloadCompiler()
3082{
3083 return ::clUnloadCompiler();
3084}
3085#endif // #if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
3086
3095class Context
3096 : public detail::Wrapper<cl_context>
3097{
3098private:
3099 static std::once_flag default_initialized_;
3100 static Context default_;
3101 static cl_int default_error_;
3102
3108 static void makeDefault() {
3109 /* Throwing an exception from a call_once invocation does not do
3110 * what we wish, so we catch it and save the error.
3111 */
3112#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3113 try
3114#endif
3115 {
3116#if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
3117 const Platform &p = Platform::getDefault();
3118 cl_platform_id defaultPlatform = p();
3119 cl_context_properties properties[3] = {
3120 CL_CONTEXT_PLATFORM, (cl_context_properties)defaultPlatform, 0
3121 };
3122#else // #if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
3123 cl_context_properties *properties = nullptr;
3124#endif // #if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
3125
3126 default_ = Context(
3127 CL_DEVICE_TYPE_DEFAULT,
3128 properties,
3129 nullptr,
3130 nullptr,
3131 &default_error_);
3132 }
3133#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3134 catch (cl::Error &e) {
3135 default_error_ = e.err();
3136 }
3137#endif
3138 }
3139
3140
3146 static void makeDefaultProvided(const Context &c) {
3147 default_ = c;
3148 }
3149
3150public:
3151#ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
3158 static void unitTestClearDefault() {
3159 default_ = Context();
3160 }
3161#endif // #ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
3162
3167 Context(
3168 const vector<Device>& devices,
3169 const cl_context_properties* properties = nullptr,
3170 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(
3171 const char *,
3172 const void *,
3173 size_type,
3174 void *) = nullptr,
3175 void* data = nullptr,
3176 cl_int* err = nullptr)
3177 {
3178 cl_int error;
3179
3180 size_type numDevices = devices.size();
3181 vector<cl_device_id> deviceIDs(numDevices);
3182
3183 for( size_type deviceIndex = 0; deviceIndex < numDevices; ++deviceIndex ) {
3184 deviceIDs[deviceIndex] = (devices[deviceIndex])();
3185 }
3186
3187 object_ = ::clCreateContext(
3188 properties, (cl_uint) numDevices,
3189 deviceIDs.data(),
3190 notifyFptr, data, &error);
3191
3192 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
3193 if (err != nullptr) {
3194 *err = error;
3195 }
3196 }
3197
3202 Context(
3203 const Device& device,
3204 const cl_context_properties* properties = nullptr,
3205 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(
3206 const char *,
3207 const void *,
3208 size_type,
3209 void *) = nullptr,
3210 void* data = nullptr,
3211 cl_int* err = nullptr)
3212 {
3213 cl_int error;
3214
3215 cl_device_id deviceID = device();
3216
3217 object_ = ::clCreateContext(
3218 properties, 1,
3219 &deviceID,
3220 notifyFptr, data, &error);
3221
3222 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
3223 if (err != nullptr) {
3224 *err = error;
3225 }
3226 }
3227
3232 Context(
3233 cl_device_type type,
3234 const cl_context_properties* properties = nullptr,
3235 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(
3236 const char *,
3237 const void *,
3238 size_type,
3239 void *) = nullptr,
3240 void* data = nullptr,
3241 cl_int* err = nullptr)
3242 {
3243 cl_int error;
3244
3245#if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
3246 cl_context_properties prop[4] = {CL_CONTEXT_PLATFORM, 0, 0, 0 };
3247
3248 if (properties == nullptr) {
3249 // Get a valid platform ID as we cannot send in a blank one
3250 vector<Platform> platforms;
3251 error = Platform::get(&platforms);
3252 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
3253 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
3254 if (err != nullptr) {
3255 *err = error;
3256 }
3257 return;
3258 }
3259
3260 // Check the platforms we found for a device of our specified type
3261 cl_context_properties platform_id = 0;
3262 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < platforms.size(); i++) {
3263
3264 vector<Device> devices;
3265
3266#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3267 try {
3268#endif
3269
3270 error = platforms[i].getDevices(type, &devices);
3271
3272#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3273 } catch (cl::Error& e) {
3274 error = e.err();
3275 }
3276 // Catch if exceptions are enabled as we don't want to exit if first platform has no devices of type
3277 // We do error checking next anyway, and can throw there if needed
3278#endif
3279
3280 // Only squash CL_SUCCESS and CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND
3281 if (error != CL_SUCCESS && error != CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND) {
3282 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
3283 if (err != nullptr) {
3284 *err = error;
3285 }
3286 }
3287
3288 if (devices.size() > 0) {
3289 platform_id = (cl_context_properties)platforms[i]();
3290 break;
3291 }
3292 }
3293
3294 if (platform_id == 0) {
3295 detail::errHandler(CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
3296 if (err != nullptr) {
3297 *err = CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND;
3298 }
3299 return;
3300 }
3301
3302 prop[1] = platform_id;
3303 properties = &prop[0];
3304 }
3305#endif
3306 object_ = ::clCreateContextFromType(
3307 properties, type, notifyFptr, data, &error);
3308
3309 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
3310 if (err != nullptr) {
3311 *err = error;
3312 }
3313 }
3314
3315
3320 static Context getDefault(cl_int * err = nullptr)
3321 {
3322 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefault);
3323 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
3324 if (err != nullptr) {
3325 *err = default_error_;
3326 }
3327 return default_;
3328 }
3329
3337 static Context setDefault(const Context &default_context)
3338 {
3339 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefaultProvided, std::cref(default_context));
3340 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
3341 return default_;
3342 }
3343
3345 Context() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
3346
3352 explicit Context(const cl_context& context, bool retainObject = false) :
3353 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(context, retainObject) { }
3354
3360 Context& operator = (const cl_context& rhs)
3361 {
3362 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
3363 return *this;
3364 }
3365
3367 template <typename T>
3368 cl_int getInfo(cl_context_info name, T* param) const
3369 {
3370 return detail::errHandler(
3371 detail::getInfo(&::clGetContextInfo, object_, name, param),
3372 __GET_CONTEXT_INFO_ERR);
3373 }
3374
3376 template <cl_context_info name> typename
3377 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_context_info, name>::param_type
3378 getInfo(cl_int* err = nullptr) const
3379 {
3380 typename detail::param_traits<
3381 detail::cl_context_info, name>::param_type param;
3382 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
3383 if (err != nullptr) {
3384 *err = result;
3385 }
3386 return param;
3387 }
3388
3393 cl_int getSupportedImageFormats(
3394 cl_mem_flags flags,
3395 cl_mem_object_type type,
3396 vector<ImageFormat>* formats) const
3397 {
3398 cl_uint numEntries;
3399
3400 if (!formats) {
3401 return CL_SUCCESS;
3402 }
3403
3404 cl_int err = ::clGetSupportedImageFormats(
3405 object_,
3406 flags,
3407 type,
3408 0,
3409 nullptr,
3410 &numEntries);
3411 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
3412 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_SUPPORTED_IMAGE_FORMATS_ERR);
3413 }
3414
3415 if (numEntries > 0) {
3416 vector<ImageFormat> value(numEntries);
3417 err = ::clGetSupportedImageFormats(
3418 object_,
3419 flags,
3420 type,
3421 numEntries,
3422 (cl_image_format*)value.data(),
3423 nullptr);
3424 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
3425 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_SUPPORTED_IMAGE_FORMATS_ERR);
3426 }
3427
3428 formats->assign(value.begin(), value.end());
3429 }
3430 else {
3431 // If no values are being returned, ensure an empty vector comes back
3432 formats->clear();
3433 }
3434
3435 return CL_SUCCESS;
3436 }
3437
3438#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 300
3449 cl_int setDestructorCallback(
3450 void (CL_CALLBACK * pfn_notify)(cl_context, void *),
3451 void * user_data = nullptr)
3452 {
3453 return detail::errHandler(
3454 ::clSetContextDestructorCallback(
3455 object_,
3456 pfn_notify,
3457 user_data),
3458 __SET_CONTEXT_DESCTRUCTOR_CALLBACK_ERR);
3459 }
3460#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 300
3461};
3462
3463inline void Device::makeDefault()
3464{
3465 /* Throwing an exception from a call_once invocation does not do
3466 * what we wish, so we catch it and save the error.
3467 */
3468#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3469 try
3470#endif
3471 {
3472 cl_int error = 0;
3473
3474 Context context = Context::getDefault(&error);
3475 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
3476
3477 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
3478 default_error_ = error;
3479 }
3480 else {
3481 default_ = context.getInfo<CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES>()[0];
3482 default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
3483 }
3484 }
3485#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3486 catch (cl::Error &e) {
3487 default_error_ = e.err();
3488 }
3489#endif
3490}
3491
3492CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ std::once_flag Context::default_initialized_;
3493CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ Context Context::default_;
3494CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ cl_int Context::default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
3495
3504class Event : public detail::Wrapper<cl_event>
3505{
3506public:
3508 Event() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
3509
3518 explicit Event(const cl_event& event, bool retainObject = false) :
3519 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(event, retainObject) { }
3520
3526 Event& operator = (const cl_event& rhs)
3527 {
3528 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
3529 return *this;
3530 }
3531
3533 template <typename T>
3534 cl_int getInfo(cl_event_info name, T* param) const
3535 {
3536 return detail::errHandler(
3537 detail::getInfo(&::clGetEventInfo, object_, name, param),
3538 __GET_EVENT_INFO_ERR);
3539 }
3540
3542 template <cl_event_info name> typename
3543 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_event_info, name>::param_type
3544 getInfo(cl_int* err = nullptr) const
3545 {
3546 typename detail::param_traits<
3547 detail::cl_event_info, name>::param_type param;
3548 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
3549 if (err != nullptr) {
3550 *err = result;
3551 }
3552 return param;
3553 }
3554
3556 template <typename T>
3557 cl_int getProfilingInfo(cl_profiling_info name, T* param) const
3558 {
3559 return detail::errHandler(detail::getInfo(
3560 &::clGetEventProfilingInfo, object_, name, param),
3561 __GET_EVENT_PROFILE_INFO_ERR);
3562 }
3563
3565 template <cl_profiling_info name> typename
3566 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_profiling_info, name>::param_type
3567 getProfilingInfo(cl_int* err = nullptr) const
3568 {
3569 typename detail::param_traits<
3570 detail::cl_profiling_info, name>::param_type param;
3571 cl_int result = getProfilingInfo(name, &param);
3572 if (err != nullptr) {
3573 *err = result;
3574 }
3575 return param;
3576 }
3577
3582 cl_int wait() const
3583 {
3584 return detail::errHandler(
3585 ::clWaitForEvents(1, &object_),
3586 __WAIT_FOR_EVENTS_ERR);
3587 }
3588
3589#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3594 cl_int setCallback(
3595 cl_int type,
3596 void (CL_CALLBACK * pfn_notify)(cl_event, cl_int, void *),
3597 void * user_data = nullptr)
3598 {
3599 return detail::errHandler(
3600 ::clSetEventCallback(
3601 object_,
3602 type,
3603 pfn_notify,
3604 user_data),
3605 __SET_EVENT_CALLBACK_ERR);
3606 }
3607#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3608
3613 static cl_int
3614 waitForEvents(const vector<Event>& events)
3615 {
3616 static_assert(sizeof(cl::Event) == sizeof(cl_event),
3617 "Size of cl::Event must be equal to size of cl_event");
3618
3619 return detail::errHandler(
3620 ::clWaitForEvents(
3621 (cl_uint) events.size(), (events.size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events.front() : nullptr),
3622 __WAIT_FOR_EVENTS_ERR);
3623 }
3624};
3625
3626#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3631class UserEvent : public Event
3632{
3633public:
3638 UserEvent(
3639 const Context& context,
3640 cl_int * err = nullptr)
3641 {
3642 cl_int error;
3643 object_ = ::clCreateUserEvent(
3644 context(),
3645 &error);
3646
3647 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_USER_EVENT_ERR);
3648 if (err != nullptr) {
3649 *err = error;
3650 }
3651 }
3652
3654 UserEvent() : Event() { }
3655
3660 cl_int setStatus(cl_int status)
3661 {
3662 return detail::errHandler(
3663 ::clSetUserEventStatus(object_,status),
3664 __SET_USER_EVENT_STATUS_ERR);
3665 }
3666};
3667#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3668
3673inline static cl_int
3674WaitForEvents(const vector<Event>& events)
3675{
3676 return detail::errHandler(
3677 ::clWaitForEvents(
3678 (cl_uint) events.size(), (events.size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events.front() : nullptr),
3679 __WAIT_FOR_EVENTS_ERR);
3680}

3727 __GET_MEM_OBJECT_INFO_ERR);
3728 }

3773// Pre-declare copy functions
3774class Buffer;
3775template< typename IteratorType >
3776cl_int copy( IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator, cl::Buffer &buffer );
3777template< typename IteratorType >
3778cl_int copy( const cl::Buffer &buffer, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator );
3779template< typename IteratorType >
3780cl_int copy( const CommandQueue &queue, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator, cl::Buffer &buffer );

3782cl_int copy( const CommandQueue &queue, const cl::Buffer &buffer, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator );
